void parse_argv0 P1 (  (av0)  ,
char *  av0
)  [static]
  

00126 {
00127     char    * c;
00128     int l;
00129 
00130         progname = av0 = endname(av0 ? av0 : "toast");
00131 
00132         /*  If the name starts with `un', we want to decode, not code.
00133          *  If the name ends in `cat', we want to write to stdout,
00134      *  and decode as well.
00135      */
00136 
00137         if (!strncmp(av0, "un", 2)) f_decode = 1;
00138         if (  (l = strlen(av0)) >= 3 /* strlen("cat") */
00139            && !strcmp( av0 + l - 3, "cat" )) f_cat = f_decode = 1;
00140 }

int open_input P2 (  (name, st)  ,
char *  name,
struct stat *  st
)  [static]
  

00462 {
00463     struct fmtdesc * f = f_format;
00464 
00465         st->st_nlink = 0;       /* indicates `undefined' value */

00467         inname = (char *)NULL;
00468         in     = stdin;
00469     }

00471         if (!f_decode) inname = strcpy(emalloc(strlen(name)+1), name);
00472         else inname = codename(name);
00473 
00474         if (!(in = fopen(inname, READ))) {
00475             perror(inname); /* not guaranteed to be valid here */
00476                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot open \"%s\" for reading\n",
00477                 progname, inname);
00478             return 0;
00479         }
00480         if (!okay_as_input(inname, in, st)) return 0;
00481         if (!f) f = grok_format(inname);
00482     }
00483     prepare_io( f ? f : & DEFAULT_FORMAT );
00484     return 1;

char* suffix P2 (  (name, suf)  ,
char *  name,
char *  suf
)  [static]
  

00205 {
00206     int nlen = strlen(name);
00207     int slen = strlen(suf);
00208 
00209     if (!slen || nlen <= slen) return (char *)0;
00210     name += nlen - slen;
00211     return memcmp(name, suf, slen) ? (char *)0 : name;
00212 }

int okay_as_input P3 (  (name, f, st)  ,
char *  name,
FILE *  f,
struct stat *  st
)  [static]
  

00396 {
00397 # ifdef HAS_FSTAT
00398     if (fstat(fileno(f), st) < 0)
00399 # else
00400     if (stat(name, st) < 0)
00401 # endif
00402     {
00403         perror(name);
00404                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot stat \"%s\"\n", progname, name);
00405         return 0;
00406     }
00407 
00408     if (!S_ISREG(st->st_mode)) {
00409         fprintf(stderr,
00410                         "%s: \"%s\" is not a regular file -- unchanged.\n",
00411             progname, name);
00412         return 0;
00413     }
00414     if (st->st_nlink > 1 && !f_cat && !f_precious) {
00415         fprintf(stderr, 
00416                       "%s: \"%s\" has %s other link%s -- unchanged.\n",
00417                         progname,name,st->st_nlink - 1,"s" + (st->st_nlink<=2));
00418         return 0;
00419     }
00420 
00421     if (!f_decode && !f_cat && name && suffix( name, SUFFIX_TOASTED )) {
00422         fprintf(stderr,
00423                         "%s: %s already has \"%s\" suffix -- unchanged.\n",
00424             progname, name, SUFFIX_TOASTED );
00425         return 0;
00426     }
00427     return 1;
00428 }

char* normalname P3 (  (name, want, cut)  ,

char *  cut
)  [static]
  

00264 {
00265     int maxlen;
00266     char    * s, * p;
00267 
00268     p = (char *)0;
00269     if (!name) return p;
00270 
00271     maxlen = strlen(name) + 1 + strlen(want) + strlen(cut);
00272     p = strcpy(emalloc(maxlen), name);
00273 
00274     if (s = suffix(p, cut)) strcpy(s, want);
00275     else if (*want && !suffix(p, want)) strcat(p, want);
00276 
00277     return p;
